channel.title: Malware Analysis: Or How I Learned To Love Frustration
channel.description: Recent content on Malware Analysis: Or How I Learned To Love Frustration

item.title: Great resources for starting out in malware reverse engineering
item.description: A list of resources for people looking to start their adventure into the wonderful world of malware reverse engineering. This list will be dynamically updated as and when I can evaluate new training material (both paid and free) available on the market.

item.title: The difference between dynamic and static analysis
item.description: Explaining the fundamental differences in dynamic and static analysis in reverse engineering malware samples across Windows, Mac and Nix endpoints.

item.title: Delving into BlueNorOff malware
item.description: In this article, we examine a newer strand of Bluenoroff malware from late 2023 on MacOS systems. It’s our first look at a strand of malware from an APT.

item.title: Analysis of PureLand Info Stealer
item.description: Analysis of an information stealer application designed for MacOS systems alongside a detailed breakdown of the structure of iOS applications to aid in future analysis of mac malware.

item.title: [Part 2] Creating a safe (and functional) RE environment on Apple Silicon - UTM
item.description: This blog post will guide you through the key programs and downloads required to successfully set up a functional and safe malware environment on M series MacBooks using UTM.

item.title: [Part 1] Creating a safe (and functional) RE environment on Apple Silicon - VMWare Fusion
item.description: This blog post will guide you through the key programs and downloads required to successfully set up a functional and safe malware environment on M series MacBooks using VMWare Fusion.

item.title: You make me WannaSmile
item.description: Analysis of ‘WannaSmile’ ransomware using dnSpy to pull apart and understand the behaviour and crypto functions used by this binary to encrypt machines.

item.title: 0xCC Conference
item.description: I was lucky enough to be in a position to attend 0xCC this year, run by women, for women in tech. This is a collection of my thoughts and feelings about the value this conference had in my career.

item.title: HTB Challenge: Simple Encryptor Part 1
item.description: Pulling apart a custom simple encryptor from a Hack the Box RE challenge using Ghidra. Part 1 of 2 explores the static analysis process.

item.title: Starting Small: Analysis of recent vjw0rm variant
item.description: Analysis of a recent variant of vjw0rm. I walk through my approach to analysing the sample, the challenges I faced in completing the task, resources I leveraged to overcome these and finally the lessons I learned along the way.

item.title: An Introduction
item.description: An introductory post outlining the purpose of this blog, my background and a small dedication to those who inspired me.
